genome_annotation package

There are two types of genomes:

those that are already annotated and validated and cannot be (re)annotated by users, and those that are unannotated and can be annotated by annotators in our system. When an unannotated genome is added to the database, the validator assigns sequences to be annotated to annotators. Each sequence can only be assigned to one annotator. When annotators log in to the system, they can access an interface where they can access the sequences that have been assigned to them. Once completed, each annotation must be validated by the validator before it is considered validated in the database.
